metadata.title: CVE-2021-41229 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description: BlueZ is a Bluetooth protocol stack for Linux. In affected versions avulnerability exists in sdp_cstate_alloc_buf which allocates memory whichwill always be hung in the singly linked list of cstates and will not befreed. This will cause a memory leak over time. The data can be a verylarge object, which can be caused by an attacker continuously sending sdppackets and this may cause the service of the target device to crash.

criterions.comment: bluez: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
